item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "unreal, I believed I had become merely a shimmer." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "I am fat with love! Husky with ardor! Morbidly obese with devotion! A happy, busy bumblebee of marital enthusiasm. I positively hum around him, fussing and fixing. I have become a strange thing. I have become a wife. I find myself steering the ship of conversations- bulkily, unnaturally- just so I can say his name aloud. I have become a wife, I have become a bore, I have been asked to forfeit my Independent Young Feminist card. I don't care. I balance his checkbook, I trim his hair. I've gotten so retro, at one point I will probably use the word pocketbook, shuffling out the door in my swingy tweed coat, my lips red, on the way to the beauty parlor. Nothing bothers me. Everything seems like it will turn out fine, every bother transformed into an amusing story to be told over dinner. 'So I killed a hobo today, honey...hahahaha! Ah, we have fun" -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "Nick is like a good stiff drink: He gives everything the correct perspective." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "She released her grievances like handfuls of birdseed: They are there, and they are gone." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "We are all overdressed in our little flashy frocks, our slasher heels, and we all eat small plates of food bites that are as decorative and unsubstantial as we are." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "No legacy is so rich as honesty." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Remember that wherever your heart is, there you will find your treasure." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "And that's the thing about people who mean everything they say. They think everyone else does too." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Truth never damages a cause that is just." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Warren Buffett
item.description: "Honesty is a very expensive gift, Don't expect it from cheap people." -- Warren Buffett

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Aesop's Fables, Including The Boy Who Cried Wolf
item.description: "Nobody believes a liar...even when he is telling the truth!" -- Aesop's Fables, Including The Boy Who Cried Wolf

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Ethan from "The Thunder in Heaven"
item.description: "My life's an open book. Some of the pages are a little ripped, but it's open." -- Ethan from "The Thunder in Heaven"

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment." -- Rumi

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "Never trust people who smile constantly. They're either selling something or not very bright." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do one thing every day that scares you." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "We love the things we love for what they are." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by George Meredith
item.description: "A witty woman is a treasure; a witty beauty is a power." -- George Meredith

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "I can choose either to be a victim of the world or an adventurer in search of treasure. It's all a question of how I view my life." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Where there is ruin, there is hope for a treasure." -- Rumi

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Ordinary riches can be stolen, real riches cannot. In your soul are infinitely precious things that cannot be taken from you." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Lydiaohlydia add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Everyone on earth has a treasure that awaits him." -- Paulo Coelho
